info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 12:01PM CST until March 12 at 9:41PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...Until late Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Agricultural levee begins to be slightly overtopped. No residences are affected at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CST Monday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM CST Monday was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 19.7 Mon 8 pm 23.8 22.7 18.8 14.8 13.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
